titleStmt.title: Malkǝʾ-hymns, Excerpts from the New Testament, Miracles of Mary, Miracles of Jesus, Homily by Jacob of Serug on the Angel and the Thief

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.title: Hymns
msItem.note: Hymns are designated as ‘salām-hymn’ when starting with ሰላም፡ and as ‘ʿārke-hymn’ when starting with other words. A relation to is possible. It might be related to the events leading up to the siege of , especially the cannon (ቦምባ፡) brought there, as related in 46-47, where a Rās Bisawwǝr is also mentioned as የመቅደላ፡ ጠባቂ፡ (50).

notatedMusic.desc: The text is furnished with musical notation.

msItem.incipit: ኦእግዝእትነ፡ የሀሉ፡ ድንግል፡ በ፪ ማርያም፡ ማረሃም፡ እሙ፡ ኦንጉሥነ፡ ኢያሱ፡ ብርሃን። ከሀሊ፨ ኀበ፡ ይትነበብ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ተአምርኪ፡ ቄሐ፡ ኀዘን፡ ጸልሊ፨ ወዘሰማዕነ፡ በልብነ፡ አብቍሲ፨ አዕፁቂሁ፡ ወአልዕሊ፨ ወሕንባባቲሁ፡ አፅድሊ፨
msItem.explicit:
በዝ፡ ዓለም፡ እምኔነ፡ ኢትሰሰሊ፨ ወበዘይመጽእ፡ ዓለም፡ ወልድኪ፡ ወለተ፡ ሚካኤል፡
፩ በእንተ፡ ቅዳሜ፡ ኀሩያነ፡
፪ በእንተ፡
ብፁዓን።
፫ በእንተ፡ ወተናገሮሙ፡
፬ በእንተ፡ ወልደ ለእግዚእነ።
msItem.note: A stichometric note, that states that the Gospel of Matthew has 2700 lines (according to the meaning of ቃል፡ in this context), is added at the end of the text on : ወንጌል፡ ዘማቴዎስ፡ ቃሉ፡ ፳፻ወ፯፻።. This section includes the following biblical quotations and prayers: Gospel of Luke 20:27-38 (, ), Prayer of the incense (ጸሎተ፡ ዕጣን፡, ),

msItem.incipit: ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ በ፪ ማርያም፡ ማረሃም፡ እሙ፡ ለኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ከሀሊ፨ ኀበ፡ ይትነበብ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ተአምርኪ፡ አክናፈኪ፡ ጸልሊ፨ ወዘሰማዕነ፡ በልብነ፡ አብቍሲ፨ አዕፁቂሁ፡ አልዕሊ፨ ወሕንባባቲሁ፡ አፅድሊ፨
msItem.explicit: በዝ፡ ዓለም፡ እምኔነ፡ ኢትሰሰሊ፨ ወበዘይመጽእ፡ ዓለም፡ ወልድኪ፡ ነፍስነ፡ እምነፍስኪ፡ ኢይሌሊ፨ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨
በረከተ፡ አምላኩ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁሩ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ፨ ፨
ስረዩ፡ ወባርኩኒ፡ ለጸሐፊሃ፡ አቡነ፡ ዘበሰማያት፡ ወሰላመ፡ ገርበኤል፡፡ ዘወሀብኩ፡ ለመቅድሰ፡ ወቀይሰ፡ ገበዝሂ፡ ዘተግሃ፡ ለአጽሕፎታ፡ ። ተሰፊዎሙ፡ መንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። ኢትርስዑነ፡ አቡነ፡ ዘበሰማያት።

msItem.title: Prayer to Jesus Christ (Səbḥat laka nəngər kʷəllo səbḥatika…)
msItem.incipit: ሰላም፡ ለኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትየ፡ ማርያም፡ ድንግል፡ እመ፡ መድኅን፡ ወእመ፡ ብርሃን፨ እመ፡ ቍርባን፤ ወእመ፡ ዕጣን፤ እመ፡ ነድ፤ ወእመ፡ ዋሕድ፨ እመ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ወእመ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ እመ፡ መሲሕ፤ ወእመ፡ መለኮታዊ፡ መፍርህ፨
msItem.explicit: ቅዱሳን፡ ወንጹሓን፡ ድንግልናኪ፡ እለ፡ ይሴብሑ፨ ኀበ፡ ሥእልኪ፡ እለ፡ ይጸርሑ፡ ብርሃነ፡ ገጽኪ፡ ይትሞጥሑ፨ ኀበ፡ ቤተ፡ መርዓሁ፡ ለወልድኪ፤ ያንፈርዕፁ፡ ወይትፌሥሑ፤ ለዓለመ፤ ዓለም፤ አሜን፨ ፨ ፨

msItem.title: 2 Corinthians 8:1-15
msItem.incipit:
ወእነግረክሙ፡ አኃዊነ፡ ጸጋ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዘተውህበ፡ ለቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘመቂዶንያ፨ እስመ፡ እምብዙኀ፡ መከራ፡ ሕማሞሙ፡ ፈድፈደ፡ ፍሥሐሆሙ፡ ምስለ፡ ዕመቀ፡ ንዲቶሙ፡ ፈድፈደት፡ ፍሥሐ፡ ብዕሎሙ፨ እስመ፡
ለልየ፡ ሰማዕቶሙ፡ ከመ፡ በአምጣነ፡ ኃይሎሙ፨
msItem.explicit: እስመ፡ ተረፈ፡ ዚአክሙ፡ ውስተ፡ ንትጋ፡ እልክቱ፡ ይከውን፨ ወተረፈ፡ ዚአሆሙ፡ ውስተ፡ ንትጋ፡ ዚአክሙ፡ ከመ፡ ይኩን፡ ሀልዎትክሙ፡ ዕሩየ፡ በኵሉ፨ እስመ፡ ከመዝ፡ ይቤ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘቦ፡ ብዙኃ፡ ኢያትረፈ፡ ወዘቦ፡ ውሑድ፡ ኢያሕፀፀ፨

በረከታቲሆሙ። ለሐና፡ ወኢያቄም፡ ዘወለድዋ፡ ለማርያም፡ መራን፡ ከመ፡ ያድኅነነ፡ እመስገርት፡ አርዌ፡ ርጉም፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። ሃሌ፡ ሉያ፡ በብዝሖ፡ ኂሩት፡ ክም፡ ኢያቄም፡ ወ
ሐና፡ ሰውሩነ፡ እምሰይጣን፡ መከራ፡ ለዘቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘአንበባ፡ ወዘተርጐማ፡ ኢትርስኡኒ፡ አቡነ፡ ዘበሰማያት፡ ዘአንበብክዋ።

colophon.foreign: ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘአጽሐፎ፡ ዶክተር፡ ቤንት፡ ኢ፡ የውል፡ የንሰን፡ ወምስለ፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ወይዘሮ፡ ማርያም፡ ሜሪ፡ ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ተፈጸመ፡ በወርኃ፡ ታህሣሥ፡ በ፳ወ፭ መዓልት፡ በ፲ወ፱፻፷ወ፯ ዓመተ፡ ምሕረት፡ ወጸሐፊሁ፡ ዲያቆን፡ አምኃ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ገ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ዘብሔረ፡ ተምቤን፡ መነዌ፡ ገዳም።
colophon.note: The colophon states that the manuscript was commissioned by and his wife . It was completed on the 25th Tāḫśāś of the year of mercy 1967 EC, corresponding to the 18th January 1975. The scribe was the deacon ʾAmmǝḫā Śǝllāse from the monastery of Manāwe in Tamben.

support.p: Few tears resulting from parchment making are found on and have been repaired by sewing. is cut off after the first column. Leul Ras Mangashia Seyoum, who provided his expertise on the manuscript to Bent Juel-Jensen, takes the material to be horse vellum (cp. 65).

extent.note: The manuscript could not be weighed due to its great size.
Data on the dimensions of folios taken from .

supportDesc.foliation: Pencil foliation in the upper right corner (1–123). Originally, the number 100 had been skipped and 101 instead been used twice, corrected by the Bodleian Library in January 2020 to and .

collation.note: This is a note on collation.

item.note: This is a note on a quire.

supportDesc.condition: There are slight traces of use, such as wear along the spine. Additionally, there are dirt stains in the lower margins up to , occasional ink smudges, e.g. on ; and stains, e.g. on . Furthermore, there is evidence of water damage, which has caused the wrinkling of the parchment and left imprints from the dyed leather covers on the first and last leaves.

layout.note: Data on text area and margin dimensions taken from .
layout.ab: Ruling is visible; pricking is visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

Groups of ten psalms are separated by text dividers consisting of black and red dots, below which an irregularly executed ornamental band consisting of geometric forms, usually covering about half of a line (e.g. on ), probably added secondarily.

layout.note: Data on text area and margin dimensions taken from .
layout.ab: Ruling is visible; pricking is visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handNote.desc: Fine and regular handwriting. Regularly spaced characters.

list.item: ሰ፡ ለ፡ for ሰላም፡ ለኪ፡ (e.g. on );

decoDesc.summary: The decorative frame on marks the incipit and is painted in a style associated with works produced in the historical region of Lasta around 1700. The manuscript contains twenty framed miniatures in the Second Gondarine Style that appear to have been executed by the same hand. The style of the miniatures bears comparison with that of firmly dated manuscripts such as MS London, British Library, Or. 607 and MS London, British Library, Or. 646 suggesting that they were executed around the mid-eighteenth century that are extensively illustrated with scenes inspired by the life and miracles of St George (; 145-169 ). Further difficulties arise from the inconsistent use of attributes: St George, for example, at times has no halo. Most miniatures take up a full page, but some ½ or less (e.g ). In all likelihood, this manuscript was scribed and decorated by Gabra Krǝstos.

decoNote.desc: The Trinity on the verso is framed by an octagon and surrounded by the Tetramorph arranged in the Angel, Eagle, Ox and Lion order. On the recto, the Twenty-Four Elders from the Book of Revelation, bearing censers and crosses, turn their gaze towards the opposite page. ዳግማዊ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ኢያሱ፡ ብርሃን፡ ሰገድ። ዘከመ፥ ነግሠ፥ ንጉሥ፡ ኢያሱ፡ ብርነገሥት፥ ወነበረ፡ በመንበረ፡ አቡሁ፥ ወኮነ፡ ኁልቁ፥ ምስለ፥ ነገሥታተ፡ ኢትዮጵያ፨ በ፲፯፻፵፬ቱ ልደተ፡ እግዚእነ፥ ኢየሱስ፡ አሜን፨ አመ፡ ፋሲለደስ፡ አዋዲ፥ በአመ፡ ንግሥቱ፡ ለንጉሥ፡ ኢያሱ፡ ፪፨
Abuna ʾAbib casts himself from a tree on to a cluster of blades. His namesake, , is in proskynesis beneath him. አቡነ፡አቢብ፡ ዘከመ፡ ተማኅፀነ፡ ወልደ፡ አቢብ፡

The Crucifixion with Mary and John weeping at the sides of the cross. ስእለ፡ ስቅለት፡ On the cross: ኢያሱስ፡ ናዝራዊ፡ ንጉ On the cross: ኢያሱስ፡ ናዝራዊ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ኢይሁድ Above John and the cross: ብካየ፡ ዮሐንስ Above Mary: ብካየ፡ ማርያም
Polychrome ornamental bands with arabesque decorations mark the beginning of each gospel.
Small drawing of a grazing hippopotamus.
A pen-work text divider consisting of black and red dots and strokes marks the end of the text.

item.desc: Amharic list of objects, mainly liturgical vessels and books belonging to a church identified as Madḫāne ʿĀlam, given by , ending with a condemnation. Among the objects is also a drawing on parchment.
item.q: ኍልቈ፡ ንዋየ፡ ቅድሳት፡ ዘመድኃኔ፡ ዓለም፡ አባ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ የሰጡ፡ ፫ መስቀል፡ ፫ ጽና፡ ፩ ናስ፡ የደም፡ ጽዋ፡ ፩ ጠርሙስ፡ ፩ ቃጭል፡ ፩ የናስ፡ ማብርያ፡ ፩ የፍም፡ መጫርያ፡ መረዋት፡ ፩ ጁህ፡ በርኖስ፡ ፩ ማኅፈድ፡ ፩ ወንጌል፡ ፩ ቅዳሴ፡ ፩ ተአምረ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ፩ መዝገብ፡ ፩ የብራና፡ ሥዕል፡ ፪ ቤት፡ ያሹሩት፡ በድሙሩ፡ ፳፩ ነው፡ ይህነን፡ የተጻፈውን፡ የሸጠና፡ የሰረቀ፡ የፋቀ፡ በሥልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ይኩንx x x

item.desc: An additional list of objects written in the same hand as additional note 1, separated from additional note 1 by a fine line.
item.q: በ፯ ወቄት፡ ከ፫ ድሪም፡ የጕልላት፡ መስቀል፡ የተሰራ፡ ቍጽሩ፡ ፲፱ ነው፡ ከቃቤት፡ አለ፡

item.desc: Two stamps, hardly legible, probably by , whose name (ʾAnbā Yūsāb) is given next to them. Between the stamps is written, from right to left, on : انبا يوساب, بسم الله الرووف الرحيم المجد لله في العلا, and حَرمة, and on بسم الله الرووف الرحيم المجد لله في العلا .
Note crudely written in deep vermilion in the upper margin of the folio.

q.seg: ተዘከርነ፡ እግዚኦ፡ በሣህልከ፡ ሕዝብከ፡ ወተሰሀለነ፡ በአድህኖትከ፡

item.q: ሰላም፡ ለአስተርዕዮትከ፡ ወስተ፡ ደብረ፡ ማህው፡ ዘዮም፡ ዘምስለ፡ ቅብ ዘይት፡ ጥኡም፡ ቃለ አዋዲ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ዘንብረትከ፡ ገዳምበትንባሌከ፡ ተፈኒዎዕምሱክ፡ ልኡል፡ አዕያም፡ ሰከሀጥአትየ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ፍሕም።

item.desc: Hardly decipherable note in Gǝʿǝz and Amharic, written in red.

q.seg: ለእመ፡ ኮነ፡ ኮቦር፡ ዮሐንስ፡ በሰኑይ፡ አልቦ፡ ደዌ፡ ለሰብእ፡ አገሳ፡ የሐልቁ፡ ዝናም፡ የሐፅፅ፡ መዓር፡ ይውኅዝ፡ ሰገም፡ ይሰምር፡ ሰናይ፡ ይሰምር፡ ሕፃናት፡ ይሙውቱ ፨

ለእመ፡ በእሑድ፡ ሐማም፡ ይበዝኅ፡ እክል፡ ወነግድ፡ ይሠምር፡ ፄው፡ የሐፅፅ፡ አልባሰ፡ ሐርስ፡ ዝናም፡ የሐፅፅ፡ በጥቅምት፡ ይትሃየል፡ በሕማም፡ ሕፃ በማቴዎስ፡ ፈውሰ፡ ኩን፡ በምማርቆስ፡ ፈውሰ፡ ኩን፡ በሉቂስ፡ ፈውሰ፡ ኩን፡ በዮሐንስ፡ ወበ፬ወንጌላውያን፡ ኅድግ፡ ይቤሉከ፡ አቡ፡ ወወልድ፡መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ከመ፡ ይፃእ፡ ሕምዙ፡ ለከይሲ፡ በሐይለ፡ መስቀሉ፡ ለእግዚኢነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ በከመ፡ ኀደጉሐዋርያት።

item.desc: Excerpt from the , written in the main hand. The note reproduces the same text found on and corresponds to 172va, last line-172vb, l. 12. Liturgical directives in abbreviation and elements of the punctuation signs are rubricated.

q.seg: የ፡ ትዜንዉ። ይካ፡ ኦእግዚኦ፡ በከመ፡ አሜሃ፡ ዘንተ፡ ኅብስተ፡ ባርክ። ወፈትት፡ ወሀብ፡ እግዚኦ፡ በከመ፡ አሜሃ፡ ዘንተ፡ ጽዋዓ፡ ዕቀብ። ወቀድስ፡ ወመጡ።
በከመ፡ ሕገ፡ ላዕክ፡ አብጽሖ፡ ካዕበ፡ ዘየአቤ፡ ማዕረግ፡ ሴመተ፡ ካህነት። ወረሰዮ፡ ምሉዓ።

item.desc: Note written in black ink at the end of the text. It is barely legible and poorly understandable due to faded ink.
item.q: አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ኦአረ፡ ረአሲ፡ ኦፈጣሪ፡፡ በስመ፡ አረቅ፡ ማዕከሌነ፡ ብዕ፡ ቡተት፡

item.desc: Note written in pale black ink in the upper inner corner of the folio, stating that this manuscript belonged to .
ማርያም፡ is added in a later hand in the space left for the rubricated name of Mary.

item.q:
Miracles of the
Blessed Virgin
XVI-XVII Cent.
17 Pages
Paintings

binding.decoNote: The book is bound in wooden boards covered with reddish-brown blind-tooled leather. The front and back board are decorated with red velvet inlays.
The boards are cut to the same size as the bookblock and present external shallow bevels.

Full reddish brown leather cover. The turn-ins have been trimmed out and at the corners they form butt mitres. An additional leather patch has been added along the inner margin of the boards to fill the gap between the turn-ins. The cover shows a fine blind-tooled decoration, identical on both sides of the cover. The turn-ins and the edges are decorated as well. The decoration consists of seven concentric frames surrounding a central rectangular panel featuring a Latin cross. Frames composed by the repetition of single tools, enclosed between triple straight lines, alternate with empty ones. Proceeding from the outer to the inner frame, the repeating decoration motifs are criss-cross (two variants), wavy line, and straight strapwork elements. The cross is formed by curved dotted lines between single straight lines. At the ends of the arms of the cross there are corni-form motifs and three double circles. Double circles are also stamped at the intersections of the triple straight lines. Triple straight lines delimit six areas within the central panel. In the areas at the foot of the cross, the triple fillets form two triangles surmounted by five double circles. Just above, two grids are impressed. In the areas at the top, the straight lines cross each other to form two 6-pointed stars. Triple straight lines decorate the turn-ins where they form concentric frames, and the spine where they cross each other diagonally. Double circles decorate the edges of the boards.

Chainstitch sewing on four sewing stations (two pairs); periodic fold pattern. Two S-plied threads are used. The sewing starts from the first quire where, for each pair of sewing stations, there is one length of thread in the centre-fold, while in the rest of the quires there are two.
The spine is formed by two overlapping layers of leather. The endbands are sewn through the first layer so that the tie-downs are hidden under the second layer.

A pink string and a green textile ribbon, presumably with the function of bookmarkers, are found between the pages. More specifically, the pink string is between and , and the green ribbon between and .

Threads of various colours are inserted in the outer margins for navigating the text. More specifically, a red leaf string marker is inserted in the lower margin of and a uncoloured leaf string marker is inserted in the upper margin of . Disjoint bifolios have been repaired with overcasting, e.g. or by sewing parchment guards with side stitches along the spine fold of the quires, e.g. quire 18. The manuscript is wrapped in a modern textile embroidered with two lions and probably purchased by .

history.origin: The date of production, taking into account the handwriting and the frame on , is probably a period between the mid-seventeenth to mid-eighteenth century. The name of Rǝḫruḫ Krǝstos is mentioned in the supplication formulas throughout the manuscript following the phrase ገበርከ፡ ‘your servant’. This person was either the patron, the owner, the donor or the scribe of the manuscript.
history.provenance:
Bought by at auction on 26 November 1985, according to a sale receipt. The circumstances of the acquisition are also described in
220-224.
history.acquisition: It was acquired by the Bodleian Library in 2012.

revisionDesc.change: Corrections after review by Massimo Villa and Jacopo Gnisci
Corrections after review by Susanne Hummel and Jacopo Gnisci

div.ab:
ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ በ፪ኤ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፨ ጸሎታ፡ ወበረከታ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብራ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ወሀሎ፡ ፩ ብእሲ፡ በደብረ፡ አባ፡ መቃርስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዮሐንስ፨ ወዘልፈ፡ ታስተርእዮ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ በ፪ኤ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ወትትናገር፡ ወትረ፡ ምስሌሁ፨ ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ እንዘ፡ ይነውም፡ ምስለ፡ ረድኡ፡ ውስተ፡ በአቱ፡ ወካልእኒ፡ መነኮስ፨ ወናሁ፡ ብርሃን፡ ቦአ፡ ውስተ፡ በዓት፡ ወኮነ፡ በአምሳለ፡ ድንግል፡ እንተ፡ ባቲ፡ ክንፍ፡ ከመ፡ ንስር፡ ወሰፍሐት፡ ክነፊሃ፡ ላዕለ፡ አ
ባ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወጸለለቶ፡ ጸሎታ፡ ወበረከታ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብራ፡ ጎርጎርዮስ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ፨ ፨

ወአመ፡ አሡሩ፡ ዕለት፡ እምድኅረ፡ ዕርገቱ፡ ለእግዚእነ፡ ውስተ፡ ሰማያት፡ እንዘ፡ ጉቡአን፡ ውስተ፡ ጽርሐ፡ ጽዮን፡ በዕለተ፡ እሑድ፨ ወረደ፡ ላዕሌሆሙ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ናዛዚ፡ በከመ፡ አሰፈዎሙ፡ እግዚኦሙ፨ እስመ፡ ወረደ፡ ላዕሌሆሙ፡ እምሰማይ፡ ከመ፡ ልሳናተ፡ እሳት፡ ወፈትሐ፡ አፉሆሙ፡ ወሰትይዎ፨ ወተናገሩ፡ ኵሎሙ፡ ሶቤሃ፡ አርድእት፡ በልሳነ፡ ኵሉ፡ በሐውርት። ወወረዱ፡ እምጽርሐ፡ ጽዮን፡ ወቦኡ፡ ኢየሩሳሌም፡ ወሰምዕዎሙ፡ እለ፡ የኃድሩ፡ ውስቴታ፡ በይእቲ፡ ጊዜ፡ እምነ፡ ዓረብ፨ ወባዕዳን፡ እንዘ፡ ይትናገሩ፡ በልሳነ፡ ኵሉ፡ በሐውርት፡ አንከሩ፡ ጥቀ፨ አይሁድሰ፡ ይቤሉ፡ በበይናቲሆሙ፡ እስመ፡ እሉ፡ ሰብእ፡ ሰትዩ፡ ወይነ፡ ወሰክሩ፨ ወበእንተዝ፡ ኢየአምሩ፡ ዘይትናገሩ፨ ሣህሉ፡ ወምሕረቱ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብሩ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ፨ ፨
